2024-01-10.title: The Lost Boys
2024-01-10.synopsis:
Joe is about to be released from a detention centre. Should the judge approve his discharge, he will return to society and an uncertain life on the other side of the security fence. But when a new detainee, William, arrives in his facility, Joe starts to question his desire for freedom.

Featuring stand-out performances from Khalil Gharbia (Peter von Kant) and Julien De Saint Jean (Lie With Me), filmmaker Zeno Graton’s acclaimed first feature THE LOST BOYS is a compelling and sensitively observed portrait of burgeoning masculinity and queer sexuality.

2024-01-10.title: Napoleon
2024-01-10.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-10.title: Maestro
2024-01-10.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-10.title: The Boy And The Heron (Subtitled)
2024-01-10.synopsis: A young boy named Mahito yearning for his mother ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-10.title: Priscilla
2024-01-10.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-10.title: Saltburn
2024-01-10.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-10.title: Wonka
2024-01-10.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-10.title: Ferrari
2024-01-10.synopsis: It is the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle of Formula 1, ex-racer Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

2024-01-10.title: One Life
2024-01-10.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-10.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-10.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-10.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-10.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-10.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-10.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-10.title: DocHouse: Iraq's Invisible Beauty
2024-01-10.synopsis:
Latif al-Ani, the beloved 'father of Iraqi photography', captured his country in its heyday from the 1950s to 1970s. When Saddam Hussein took power, al-Ani put down his camera. His photographs form a unique archive showing a cosmopolitan Iraq, before the devastation of war, that many Westerners and even Iraqi people themselves have never seen.

In Iraq's Invisible Beauty, 86-year-old al-Ani travels across his devastated homeland, accompanied by Belgian-Kurdish filmmaker Sahim Omar Kalifa, in search of the places he once knew and captured on film. On this final trip, he shows his photographs to the people he meets, who cannot believe the vibrant and prosperous Iraq he presents to them.

Al-Ani died in 2021, soon after the completion of this film, which forms a moving tribute to the great photographer and the country he lost.

2024-01-11.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-11.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-11.title: One Life
2024-01-11.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-11.title: Sweet Sue
2024-01-11.synopsis: Fifty-something Sue (Maggie O’Neill) is now back on the dating scene. She meets a mysterious biker called Ron (Tony Pitts) at her brother's funeral and sparks fly. But when she meets Ron’s social-media influencer son Anthony (Harry Trevaldwyn), Sue finds herself in an increasingly surreal battle of wills with this ambitious teenager who is convinced that his dance troupe ‘Electric Destiny’ is tipped for stardom. Will she find the purpose and imagination to bring this little unconventional family together for a chance at happiness?

2024-01-11.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-11.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-11.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-11.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-11.title: Killers Of The Flower Moon
2024-01-11.synopsis: At the turn of the 20th century, oil brought a fortune to the Osage Nation, who became some of the richest people in the world overnight. The wealth of these Native Americans immediately attracted white interlopers, who manipulated, extorted, and stole as much Osage money as they could before resorting to murder. Based on a true story and told through the improbable romance of Ernest Burkhart (Leonardo DiCaprio) and Mollie Kyle (Lily Gladstone), “Killers of the Flower Moon” is an epic western crime saga, where real love crosses paths with unspeakable betrayal. Also starring Robert De Niro and Jesse Plemons, “Killers of the Flower Moon” is directed by Academy Award winner Martin Scorsese from a screenplay by Eric Roth and Martin Scorsese, based on David Grann’s best-selling book.

2024-01-11.title: DocHouse: Iraq's Invisible Beauty
2024-01-11.synopsis:
Latif al-Ani, the beloved 'father of Iraqi photography', captured his country in its heyday from the 1950s to 1970s. When Saddam Hussein took power, al-Ani put down his camera. His photographs form a unique archive showing a cosmopolitan Iraq, before the devastation of war, that many Westerners and even Iraqi people themselves have never seen.

In Iraq's Invisible Beauty, 86-year-old al-Ani travels across his devastated homeland, accompanied by Belgian-Kurdish filmmaker Sahim Omar Kalifa, in search of the places he once knew and captured on film. Al-Ani died in 2021, soon after the completion of this film, which forms a moving tribute to the great photographer and the country he lost.

2024-01-11.title: DocHouse: My Imaginary Country
2024-01-11.synopsis:
Ever since the turmoil of 1973 that forced documentary filmmaker Patricio Guzmán to leave Chile, he has documented his homeland - in films such as Nostalgia for the Light, The Pearl Button and The Cordillera of Dreams - a country still suffering under the weight of Pinochet's legacy, constitution and decades of inequality, corruption and denial.

 

Then, in October 2019, there is an unexpected revolution, a social explosion; one and a half million people demonstrate in the streets of Santiago calling for democracy, a more dignified life and a new constitution. Chile has recovered its memory.

In his latest film, the renowned documentary-maker returns his razor-sharp gaze to a country on the cusp of long overdue change.  Focussing on the on the pivotal role played by women, he traces the people's path through mass protest to constitutional change. 

With astonishment and great hope, Guzmán documents Chile's surge towards becoming the country he imagines.

2024-01-11.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-11.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

2024-01-12.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-12.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-12.title: Wonka
2024-01-12.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-12.title: Poor Things
2024-01-12.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-12.title: The Kitchen
2024-01-12.synopsis: In a dystopian London, the gap between rich and poor has been stretched to its limits. All forms of social housing have been eradicated and only The Kitchen remains. A community that refuses to move out of the place they call home. This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. We follow our unlikely pair as they struggle to forge a relationship in a system that is stacked against them.

2024-01-12.title: Rustin
2024-01-12.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-12.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-12.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-12.title: Nimona
2024-01-12.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-12.title: The Killer
2024-01-12.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-12.title: Anatomy of a Fall

2024-01-12.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-12.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-12.title: Maestro
2024-01-12.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-12.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-12.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-12.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-12.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-12.title: DocHouse: Smoke Sauna Sisterhood
2024-01-12.synopsis:
In the warm, dense heat of a Southern Estonian smoke sauna, a group of women share their innermost secrets and intimate experiences. The rituals of the sauna envelop them, as they wash away the shame trapped in their bodies.

Filmmaker Anna Hints captures this intimate space up close, without any sense of intrusion. In the dark, enclosed space, her camera - richly lit with beams of golden daylight - frames bodies and faces in chiaroscuro, while the women give voice to their past experiences: sharing, accepting, finding laughter and solace, regaining their strength through a sense of communion.

Watching Smoke Sauna Sisterhood is a transformative experience for the viewer too, brought into a corporeal world of emotional veracity and deep empathy.

2024-01-13.title: The Holdovers
2024-01-13.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly instructor (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during Christmas break to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who has just lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph).

2024-01-13.title: One Life
2024-01-13.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-13.title: Ferrari
2024-01-13.synopsis: It is the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle of Formula 1, ex-racer Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

2024-01-13.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-13.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-13.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-13.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-13.title: Kids Club: The Canterville Ghost
2024-01-13.synopsis:
In this vivid adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s classic children’s story, the ghost of Sir Simon Canterville (Stephen Fry) has been roaming his castle for centuries, searching for a descendant who can release him from his curse by performing a brave deed.  The only problem is – he keeps scaring them away!  
Finally, a family move in who refuse to be startled, and Sir Simon is able to tell his tale to the inquisitive and courageous Virgina (Emily Carey).  Can the two of them survive The Ghost Catcher (Miranda Hart), and The Reverend (Toby Jones), to bring balance to the house and set Sir Simon free?
Signature Entertainment presents The Canterville Ghost only in cinemas September 22.

2024-01-13.title: The Killer
2024-01-13.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-13.title: Nimona
2024-01-13.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-13.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-13.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-13.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-13.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-13.title: Maestro
2024-01-13.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-13.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-13.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-13.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-13.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

2024-01-13.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-13.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-13.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-13.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-13.title: DocHouse: 20 Days In Mariupol
2024-01-13.synopsis:
On the eve of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, a team of Ukrainian journalists enter the strategic eastern port city of Mariupol. During the subsequent siege and assault, as bombs fall, inhabitants flee, and access to electricity, food, water and medicine are severed, the team — the only international journalists left — struggles to cover the war and to transmit their footage out.

Ukrainian filmmaker and journalist Mstyslav Chernov offers a window into the practices of conflict zone reporters and an unflinching, anguishing account of the 20 days he and colleagues Evgeniy Maloletka and Vasilisa Stepanenko spent covering Mariupol. Chernov wonders how capturing such footage can make a difference, but residents implore them to let the world bear witness.

2024-01-14.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-14.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-14.title: Wonka
2024-01-14.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-14.title: Poor Things
2024-01-14.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-14.title: The Kitchen
2024-01-14.synopsis: In a dystopian London, the gap between rich and poor has been stretched to its limits. All forms of social housing have been eradicated and only The Kitchen remains. A community that refuses to move out of the place they call home. This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. We follow our unlikely pair as they struggle to forge a relationship in a system that is stacked against them.

2024-01-14.title: The Boy And The Heron (Subtitled)
2024-01-14.synopsis: A young boy named Mahito yearning for his mother ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-14.title: Priscilla
2024-01-14.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-14.title: Napoleon
2024-01-14.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-14.title: Rustin
2024-01-14.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-14.title: Saltburn
2024-01-14.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-14.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-14.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-14.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-14.title: The Holdovers
2024-01-14.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly instructor (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during Christmas break to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who has just lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph).

2024-01-14.title: DocHouse: Art Talent Show
2024-01-14.synopsis:
At the Prague Academy of Fine Arts, it's time for a new batch of potential students to go through the 3-day entrance exam process. The Academy's tutors prepare to put them through their paces and whittle down hundreds of hopefuls for a few coveted spots.

They will question their artistic beliefs as well as their talents, push them out of their comfort zones, encourage debate and travel with them through the highs and lows of the most important three days of their burgeoning careers.

The whole process is brilliantly observed with droll detachment by filmmakers Adéla Komrzý and Tomáš Bojar, who have created their own artistic masterpiece - landing somewhere between Ruben Östlund and Frederick Wiseman.

How do you assess artistic talent? Who gets to select the artists of the future? What role can art play in today's world? And what is the best theme for the Day 2 practical exam?

2024-01-15.title: DocHouse: Smoke Sauna Sisterhood
2024-01-15.synopsis:
In the warm, dense heat of a Southern Estonian smoke sauna, a group of women share their innermost secrets and intimate experiences. The rituals of the sauna envelop them, as they wash away the shame trapped in their bodies.

Filmmaker Anna Hints captures this intimate space up close, without any sense of intrusion. In the dark, enclosed space, her camera - richly lit with beams of golden daylight - frames bodies and faces in chiaroscuro, while the women give voice to their past experiences: sharing, accepting, finding laughter and solace, regaining their strength through a sense of communion.

Watching Smoke Sauna Sisterhood is a transformative experience for the viewer too, brought into a corporeal world of emotional veracity and deep empathy.

2024-01-16.title: Tótem

2024-01-16.title: Napoleon
2024-01-16.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-16.title: One Life
2024-01-16.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-16.title: Ferrari
2024-01-16.synopsis: It is the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle of Formula 1, ex-racer Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

2024-01-16.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-16.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-16.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-16.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-16.title: Nimona
2024-01-16.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-16.title: The Killer
2024-01-16.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-16.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-16.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-16.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-16.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-16.title: Maestro
2024-01-16.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-16.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-16.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-16.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-16.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-16.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-16.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

2024-01-16.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-16.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-17.title: DocHouse: Art Talent Show
2024-01-17.synopsis:
At the Prague Academy of Fine Arts, it's time for a new batch of potential students to go through the 3-day entrance exam process. The Academy's tutors prepare to put them through their paces and whittle down hundreds of hopefuls for a few coveted spots.

They will question their artistic beliefs as well as their talents, push them out of their comfort zones, encourage debate and travel with them through the highs and lows of the most important three days of their burgeoning careers.

The whole process is brilliantly observed with droll detachment by filmmakers Adéla Komrzý and Tomáš Bojar, who have created their own artistic masterpiece - landing somewhere between Ruben Östlund and Frederick Wiseman.

How do you assess artistic talent? Who gets to select the artists of the future? What role can art play in today's world? And what is the best theme for the Day 2 practical exam?
